titles.title: Shin`ya! Tensai Bakabon
Shinya! Tensai Bakabon
深夜! 天才バカボン
Late Night! The Genius Bakabon
심야! 천재 바카본
深夜！天才傻鹏

anime.description: The pinnacle of gag manga as well as one of Akatsuka Fujio`s most renowned works, "Tensai Bakabon" returns after 18 years since its last anime with Director Hosokawa Toru`s new original story! Bakabon and his family, who made the phrase "This is how it should be" famous, are back along with the eccentric cast of Mr. Policeman, Rerere no Ojisan and Eel-Dog letting loose in a much more modern setting! The new frontier of "Bakabon" that`ll take place in a late-night slot is about to begin, 10 years after Akatsuka Fujio`s death. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: satire
tag.description: In satire, vices, follies, abuses, and shortcomings are held up to ridicule, ideally with the intent of shaming individuals, and society itself, into improvement. Although satire is usually meant to be funny, its greater purpose is often constructive social criticism, using wit as a weapon. (Wikipedia)

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: DESCRIPTION MISSING
tag.description: The description for this entry is missing. e.g plot, biography... Please help by adding it, and remove this tag afterwards. Thank you.

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

character.name: Hajime
character.description: Bakabon`s younger brother. He is a child prodigy, understanding words almost immediately after his birth and being capable of explaining the Pythagorean theorem and Kepler`s laws of planetary motion. His name means "beginning". Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Bakabon
character.description: A young boy who enjoys causing mischief, especially with his Papa. On the inside, though, he is a kind boy and works a part-time job as a shoeshine in order to buy his mother a birthday present. He is known for not wearing pants underneath his kimono. At the beginning of the series he attends Boumou Eggplant Elementary School, but by the fourth anime it has been renamed Bakada Elementary School. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Bakabon no Papa
character.description: Bakabon`s troublemaker father who eventually steals the show and becomes the central character. His catchphrase is saying Kore de ii noda (これでいいのだ It`ll be allright) to someone when trying to get them to go along with one of his stupid plans. A typical episode plot involves Papa either being too stupid to perform a simple task or coming up with some crazy idea to accomplish a simple task, usually asking for his son Bakabon`s advice and causing tons of trouble in either case. He was once very smart but became an idiot after an accident. He is known for always wearing his trademark hachimaki. His favorite food is octopus. Papa has become an anime icon in Japan and was even ranked Number 9 in a 2002 TV Asahi Top 100 Anime Characters list. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Bakabon no Mama
character.description: Bakabon`s mother and a graduate of Kuroyuri Women`s University (a parody of Shirayuri Women`s University). Despite how much trouble and mischief Papa and Bakabon cause, she is a good wife and mother. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Rerere no Ojisan
character.description: The Bakabon family`s odd neighbor, named so for his tendency to say Rerere (rather than are (あれ)) when confused about the countless shenanigans in the series. He is almost always seen sweeping the street outside of his yard. He is bald, has a moustache but no nose, ears that extend slightly off of his head, and wears a yukata and geta sandals. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 課金!! 天才バカボン / 擬人化するのだ
Microtransactions!! Late Night! The Genius Bakabon / Anthropomorphize It
Kakin!! Tensai Bakabon / Gijinka Suru no Da
episode.summary: apa is visited by two of his underclassmen. The first one can’t seem to stop paying for microtransactions and the second needs ideas for a new game featuring anthropomorphic characters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 映画に出るのだ / 3人目がほしいのだ
We`re Going to Be in a Movie / I Want a Third
Eiga ni Deru no Da / 3 Ninme ga Hoshii no Da
episode.summary: Bakabon and his family end up in a movie and Papa decides that he wants a third child. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めんどうくさいのだ / 女のコにモテたいのだ
This Is a Pain / I Want Women to Like Me
Mendoukusai no Da / Onnanoko ni Motetai no Da
ひさしぶりにアニメになったのだ
We Got Turned Into an Anime Again
Hisashiburi ni Anime ni Natta no Da
episode.summary: Bakabon and his family are back in this new anime after 18 years of being off the air. Are they ready for this new era, or have things changed way too much? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
活躍したいのだ / ウナギイヌの法事
I Want Some Action / Eel-Dog`s Memorial Service
Katsuyaku Shitai no Da / Unagiinu no Houji
episode.summary: Mr. Policeman makes it clear that he wants to stand out more and we get a glance at Eel-Dog’s personal life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プレゼンしますのだ / 人気声優になりたいのだ
We`ll Do a Presentation / I Want to Become a Popular Seiyuu
Presen Shimasu no Da / Ninki Seiyuu ni Naritai no Da
episode.summary: One of Papa’s kouhais visits again and decides to make presentations about everything. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漫画家になるのだ / アニメは大変なのだ
Anime Is Hard
Mangaka ni Naru no Da / Anime wa Taihen na no Da
episode.summary: Papa decides he`s going to become a manga artist so he can buy Bakabon a prime-time broadcast slot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 深夜の限界に挑戦する / テレ東からの呼び出し / 模範的な深夜! 天才バカボン
We Test the Limits of Late Night!
Shin`ya no Genkai ni Chousen Suru / Tere Higashi kara Sakebidashi / Mohanteki na Shin`ya! Tensai Bakabon
episode.summary: Papa and the others find out just how far they can go on late night shows. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ほんとうの最終回なのだ
This Is the Actual Final Episode
Hontou no Saishuukai na no Da
episode.summary: This is the real final episode. We promise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みなさん, さようならなのだ
Goodbye, Everyone
Minasan, Sayounara na no Da
episode.summary: Bakabon and Hajime travel into the past to try to prevent their father from turning into an idiot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才ハジメ
Genius Hajime
Tensai Hajime
episode.summary: Hajime makes a time machine and the family visits the future. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本官の適正テストなのだ / リアル天才バカボン
Mr. Policeman`s Aptitude Test / Real Genius Bakabon
Honkan no Tekisei Test na no Da / Real Tensai Bakabon
episode.summary: Mr. Policeman gets assessed to see if he’s really fit for this job and we get to see what a more realistic Bakabon would look like. Source: crunchyroll
